alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 13 at 4:13PM MST until September 13 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West of Paulden in Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 715 PM MST. * At 409 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area, from 5 to 15 miles west of Paulden. Between 1 and 2.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sullivan Buttes, Big Chino Wash in Paulden, Walnut Creek Ranger Station and Mount Hope. This includes State Route 89 between mile markers 336 and 337. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... North Fork Walnut Creek, Williamson Valley Wash, Big Chino Wash, Muddy Creek, Walnut Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
